1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Shorthand types and functions.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Shorthand
6 ( -- * Derived types
7   Pair, Twin,
8
9   -- * Infix operators
10   (&),
11   (++), (<++>),
12   (<$$>),
13   (<#>), (<#!>),
14
15   -- * Functions
16   ordEq, compareOn,
17   int, integer,
18   nothing,
19 ) where
20
21import Prelude hiding ((++))
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Type as O
23
24
25-- ============================================  Types
26
27-- | Pair of /a/ and /b/.
28type Pair a b = (a, b)
29
30-- | Pair of /a/ and /a/.
31type Twin a = (a, a)
32
33
34-- ============================================  Infix operators
35
36infixr 0 &
37
38-- | Pairing operator.
39--
40--   >>> "a" & "b"
41--   ("a", "b")
42--
43--   >>> "a" & "b" & "c"
44--   ("a", ("b", "c"))
45--
46{-# INLINE (&) #-}
47(&) :: a -> b -> (a, b)
48a & b = (a, b)
49
50infixr 6 ++
51
52-- | Associative operator of monoid,
53--   same as 'mappend' or infix '<>'.
54--
55--   >>> Just "abc" ++ Nothing ++ Just "def"
56--   Just "abcdef"
57--
58{-# INLINE (++) #-}
59(++) :: (Monoid a) => a -> a -> a
60(++) = mappend
61
62-- | Same as 'concatMap'.
63--
64--   >>> words <++> ["foo bar", "baz quux"]
65--   ["foo","bar","baz","quux"]
66--
67{-# INLINE (<++>) #-}
68(<++>) :: (a -> [b]) -> [a] -> [b]
69(<++>) = concatMap
70
71infixl 4 <$$>
72
73-- | Double fmap.
74--
75--   >>> length <$$> [("a", "apple"), ("b", "banana"), ("c", "cocoa")]
76--   [("a",5), ("b",6), ("c",5)]
77--
78(<$$>) :: (Functor f, Functor g) => (a -> b) -> f (g a) -> f (g b)
79f <$$> x = fmap f <$> x
80
81-- | Monadic mapping, same as 'mapM'.
82{-# INLINE (<#>) #-}
83(<#>) :: (Monad m, Traversable t) => (a -> m b) -> t a -> m (t b)
84(<#>) = mapM
85
86-- | Execution by monadic mapping, same as 'mapM_'.
87{-# INLINE (<#!>) #-}
88(<#!>) :: (Monad m, Traversable t) => (a -> m b) -> t a -> m ()
89(<#!>) = mapM_
90
91
92-- ============================================  Function
93
94-- | Test equality using 'Ord' method.
95--   This function can be used for implementing 'Eq' instance.
96--
97--   > instance Eq X where
98--   >   (==) = ordEq
99--
100ordEq :: (Ord a) => a -> a -> Bool
101ordEq x y = (x `compare` y) == EQ
102
103-- | @compareOn@ /f/ /x/ /y/ comapres /f x/ and /f y/
104--   instead of /x/ and /y/.
105--
106--   >>> compareOn length "foo" "bar"
107--   EQ
108--
109compareOn :: (Ord b) => (a -> b) -> a -> a -> Ordering
110compareOn f x y = f x `compare` f y
111
112-- | 'Int' shorthand.
113--
114--   >>> int 12
115--   12
116--
117--   This is same as:
118--
119--   >>> 12 :: Int
120--   12
121--
122{-# INLINE int #-}
123int :: O.Map Int
124int = id
125
126-- | 'Integer' shorthand.
127--
128--   >>> integer 12
129--   12
130--
131--   This is same as:
132--
133--   >>> 12 :: Integer
134--   12
135--
136{-# INLINE integer #-}
137integer :: O.Map Integer
138integer = id
139
140-- | Function which always returns 'Nothing'.
141--
142--   >>> nothing True :: Maybe String
143--   Nothing
144--
145nothing :: a -> Maybe b
146nothing _ = Nothing
